: Феодосия) is a beautiful, quaint little resort town on the Black Sea coast in

As a highly sought-after getaway spot for Russian-speaking vacationers, Feodosiya's population swells in the late spring, summer, and early fall months.

Feodosiya is 100km to the east of
. From the outskirts it looks like an urban industrial disaster but once past the factories it has a very nice old town. Very similar to
in architecture but on a smaller scale.
There are many buses that leave from the train station in

going to Feodosiya, almost every hour.
You can also take the train.
It's not that big of a city, so mostly you can walk or take the city buses.

value: is the former palace of a very wealthy tobacco merchant.

is filled with what used to be very large wealthy houses that have fallen into a state of total decay. You may enjoy a long walk through the city just observing the stray cats, the broad streets over grown with trees and vines or the abandoned houses.
In the hills on the east side of the city there is an

which, though difficult to find is very interesting to see.  On the way up to the cemetery you'll pass through some very poor (but safe and beautiful) neighborhoods.  As you near the cemetery you'll notice that some of the houses have included the former headstones from the cemetery as decorations.
